content:
Here is an example of an ABC music file that uses whole notes, half notes, quarter notes, and eighth notes:
```
X:1
T:My Tune
M:4/4
L:1/4
K:C
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
```
This file describes a simple melody in the key of C with a 4/4 time signature. The melody consists of whole notes, half notes, quarter notes, and eighth notes, indicated by the length of the notes. The vertical lines (|) indicate measures.

To create a tune using these note lengths, you can simply replace the letters in the melody with different notes. For example, to create a melody using only the notes C, D, E, and F, you could replace the letters in the melody with those notes, like this:
```
X:1
T:My Tune
M:4/4
L:1/4
K:C
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
C2 D2 E2 F2 | G2 A2 B2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 | C2 C2 C2 C2 |
```
You can continue to modify the melody by changing the notes and their lengths, as well as adding chords and other elements to create a more complex and interesting tune.
